Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2015 11:22PM - edited Apr 10, 2015 11:23PM by lisa9101 I have 8 more radiation treatments to go and than I am on to the next phase. Right now the only thing that is a little uncomfortable is the nipple area, but it is not overbearing. I have some redness starting under the armpit. I have continued to work through all the treatments, and there are some days that I am overly tired, but I just go to bed earlier. I am now worried about starting the tamoxifen, does anyone have any input on the pro and cons? I do smoke....(I know bad habit) my oncologist said that the percentage difference for people who  did radiation and tamoxifen verses the people who did radiation alone, is not the much difference. He recommended we just try  it for a month and see how it affects me.
Posts.Title: A rad onc weighs in on radiation "burns" Spinnerpom 53nancy

Posts.Content: lisa9101 wrote: I finished my 33 rounds of radiation on April 23rd, yesterday when I went in for my Tamoxifen checkup ( all the blood work and my levels are where they need to be) I told the Dr. my neck and ear was hurting, he did not look at my ear but felt around on my neck, and told me to take a baby aspirin every day. When I got home they called and said he would like for me to have an ultrasound done on the soft tissue of my neck because my lymph nodes are enlarged. Has anyone had this issue??? Dx 1/12/2015, DCIS, 2cm, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: neck lymph nodes after dcis and radiation lisa9101 inks
